thread.title: Trump and Putin 'MUST team up to wipe out ISIS for good', says military expert
thread.title_full: Trump and Putin 'MUST team up to wipe out ISIS for good', says military expert

title: Trump and Putin 'MUST team up to wipe out ISIS for good', says military expert
text:
“For Trump that means working with al-Assad and with Russia” Ivan Konovalov 
The US president has made wiping ISIS off the face of the Earth his number one priority, as the terrorist scum faces annihilation in Iraq. 
But a military adviser has warned the Donald that he won't be able to "smash the s***" out of ISIS in Syria without back-up. 
Russian and US warplanes took part in their first ever joint combat mission in Syria last month , and Russian military expert Ivan Konovalov stated the two super powers would need to draw up a long-term plan to destroy ISIS. 
GETTY DEADLY ALLIANCE: Putin and Trump need each other to finish off ISIS 
He said: "The Syrian army's main offensive is the only way to accomplish the capture of Palmyra, the liberation of Deir ez-Sor and then the advance on Raqqa. 
"And for Trump that means working with al-Assad and with Russia." 
Trump has thrown out plans left by former president Barrack Obama to take the ISIS capital of Raqqa. On patrol with the Iraqi forces driving ISIS terrorists from Mosul   The city of Mosul has been an ISIS stronghold since they took control of the city in January 2014. The Iraqi army claim to have taken it back, and defeated the Islamist terrorists. 1 / 12 AFP/Getty Images CTS soldiers fatigued from battle. 
A White House official said this was due to a lack of detail on troop numbers and training. 
Mr Konovalov added: "President Donald Trump is a businessman and a man who is accustomed to thinking straight. 
"He has obviously realised that Obama had no plan at all." 
The billionaire businessman has now advised his secretary of defence, James Mattis, to draw up a new plan to take Raqqa in the next 30 days. 
Syrian forces have announced the third phase of their offensive against the terror cell in Raqqa , where fighters will lay siege to the capital preventing movement in and out of the city. Related articles
